Summary: The 3 West Club is in an excellent location near Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is not a typical chain hotel and does not offer room service.

Hotel 414 is a small, intimate, and calm haven near Restaurant Row and Times Square. It is known for its charming leafy patio, sensually pleasing bedrooms with photographic cityscapes, and convivial breakfast setting at a long table.
60 Thompson is a hotel in the heart of Soho with a rooftop bar and sometimes a bar in the lobby; rooms have DVD players and CD stereos. Concierges are helpful with restaurant and bar reservations.

6 Columbus is a modern, trendy boutique hotel with a great location near Central Park and Columbus Circle, offering easy access to subways and various attractions. While rooms can be small, the staff is generally friendly and helpful.

70 Park Avenue is a small boutique hotel with a cozy atmosphere, offering a free wine reception, comfortable beds, and a convenient location near Grand Central Station. Some guests found the hotel quiet and relaxing, while others experienced noise issues.
The Ace Hotel has a "hipster vibe," a lively lobby scene, and a cool bar, with guests describing it as funky, trendy, and edgy. The hotel provides breakfast, free wifi, and welcomes dogs.

The hotel is in a great location with the subway a block away and is close to major attractions; Many reviewers felt the hotel had friendly and helpful service. It has a club room to relax in and get coffee all day, with wine in the evenings.

The Affinia Dumont has a great location, is in a quiet area, has a kitchen, and is near the subway. The hotel offers amenities to help guests relax, including a spa and fitness center, and has many repeat customers.

Affinia Gardens is a quiet, tranquil hotel with spacious rooms, kitchens, and a tea bar in the lobby, located on the Upper East Side near Central Park and close to subway stops. It's described as family-friendly and having a zen-like philosophy, offering a relaxing atmosphere away from the hectic city.

The Affinia Manhattan's central location near Penn Station, subways, and major attractions like Times Square and Macy's makes it easy to explore the city. Some reviewers recommend asking the concierge for local tips on restaurants, shows and transportation.
The hotel is in a good location in Murray Hill and convenient to many attractions. The rooms are modern and spacious, offering comfortable beds.

AKA United Nations offers spacious, modern apartments with full kitchens and comfortable living spaces, located conveniently near Grand Central Terminus and the UN. Some guests have noted friendly staff and available amenities like complimentary breakfast and internet access, while others have mentioned potential noise issues from construction or traffic.

The Algonquin Hotel is a historic, centrally located hotel, with a charming, cozy atmosphere and a lobby that invites relaxation. The hotel boasts friendly staff, comfortable beds, and is near Times Square and other attractions.

The Americana Inn is a budget-friendly hotel in Midtown Manhattan with small, basic rooms and shared bathrooms that are generally clean; it can be noisy due to its central location. Reviews mention friendly staff, good security, and proximity to major attractions like Times Square and the Empire State Building.

Amsterdam Court Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and subway lines, with small, clean rooms. Some rooms lack natural light, and some reviewers mention noise, slow elevators, and staff inconsistencies.

Astor on the Park is a basic, clean, and small hotel located on Central Park West, near subway stations; some rooms have views of Central Park and the Manhattan skyline. Reviews mention that some rooms can be noisy due to plumbing or street traffic, and the hotel is a bit far from the main tourist areas, requiring subway or taxi rides to reach midtown and downtown attractions.

The Bedford Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station and provides spacious rooms with kitchenettes, though some rooms may be outdated. The hotel is situated in a quiet, safe area with easy access to transportation and nearby diners and restaurants.

The Beekman Tower Hotel offers spacious suites with kitchens, providing a home-like feel, and is located in a quiet, safe, and mostly residential neighborhood, a few blocks from the UN. While somewhat removed from the main attractions, it is conveniently near bus lines and offers a rooftop bar with great views for relaxation.

The Belleclaire Hotel is located in a residential area of the Upper West Side near Central Park and subway lines; it has small, clean rooms, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Some rooms have shared bathrooms, and some past guests have noted slow elevators, street noise, and noisy air conditioning or heating units.

The Bentley Hotel is located in a quiet residential area on the Upper East Side, with a bus stop right outside for convenient transportation. Some found it easy to relax and enjoy the city, while others noted the subway was a 10-15 minute walk.

The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is located in Chinatown/Little Italy, offering easy access to multiple subway lines. Some reviewers enjoyed the bustling neighborhood and found it easy to explore different areas of the city from this location.

The hotel is described as basic, clean, and functional, with small rooms and a complimentary continental breakfast. It's located in an industrial area, a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square and the subway, with a 24-hour auto shop across the street.

The Best Western Hospitality House offers spacious apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, providing a comfortable, home-like experience with complimentary breakfast items. Centrally located in midtown Manhattan, it's within walking distance of many attractions and subway lines.

The Best Western Seaport Inn is located in the South Street Seaport area, near the Brooklyn Bridge, Financial District, and multiple subway lines. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast, and some rooms have views of the Brooklyn Bridge.

The Blue Moon Hotel is a renovated tenement building with a historic, artistic atmosphere, offering spacious, clean rooms, complimentary breakfast, and friendly staff. It is located in the Lower East Side, near various cultural attractions and subway lines.

The Broadway Plaza Hotel is a small, clean hotel near the subway, with large rooms, and free coffee and tea available 24/7; it is located in the garment district, an area that is quiet at night. Some reviewers mention that it is basic and has few frills, though it is clean and the staff are friendly.

The Buckingham Hotel offers apartment-style rooms with kitchens and is located near Central Park and Carnegie Hall. Some rooms are renovated while others are more dated, and noise from the city streets can be an issue.

The Candlewood Suites Times Square is a new hotel with small suite-style rooms that include a full-size refrigerator and a kitchen. It is located a 5-10 minute walk from Times Square and close to the Port Authority bus terminal and subway.

The Carlton Arms is an artsy, budget-friendly hotel with each room uniquely decorated by artists, offering a different and adventurous experience. Guests can choose their room upon arrival and should expect a laid-back atmosphere with minimal amenities and shared bathrooms.

The Carvi Hotel is a small, new, and clean hotel with comfortable beds and marble bathrooms. It is located conveniently to subway lines, Starbucks, and a CVS, but some rooms may have a poor view or noise from building air conditioning.

The Casablanca Hotel is in a central location right off Times Square and features Rick's Cafe, a lounge that is open 24/7 with free drinks, pastries, and newspapers, as well as complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. The hotel is a smaller boutique hotel that provides a homelike, quiet atmosphere, and many past guests praise its friendly, helpful staff.

Chambers Hotel is known for its stylish, modern, and hip design with a unique industrial feel and art pieces on display. Rooms include features like sketch pads, color pencils, and french windows that open, offering a relaxed and sophisticated atmosphere.

Chelsea Lodge is a clean, budget-friendly hotel in a safe, quiet Chelsea neighborhood, close to subway stations and various shops and restaurants, where you can feel like a local. Some rooms have shared bathrooms, and street noise can be a factor in some rooms.

Chelsea Pines Inn is praised for its friendly, helpful staff and convenient location near subway lines and various neighborhoods. Many reviewers describe a welcoming, home-like atmosphere, with amenities like complimentary breakfast, all-day coffee, and a daily newsletter of local events.

The Chelsea Savoy is a conveniently located, basic hotel near the subway, offering clean rooms and complimentary coffee and pastries. It is situated in Chelsea, near shops and restaurants, and is within walking distance of Times Square.

The City Club Hotel is a small, trendy boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan with comfortable beds and a helpful staff. Keep in mind that some rooms are small with minimal storage, and there may be construction noise.

The Solita Soho is located at the intersection of Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho, within walking distance of many restaurants, shops and subway stops. Rooms are small, but clean and modern, with flat-screen TVs and free internet access.

Club Quarters Downtown is noted for its clean, modern rooms and convenient location near subway lines, making it easy to access various parts of Manhattan. The Financial District location is quiet on weekends, offering a peaceful stay away from the bustling tourist areas.

Club Quarters Midtown is a no-frills business hotel that emphasizes self-service and a convenient location, offering basic amenities such as free WiFi and computer access. Rooms are small but clean, and the hotel is near Times Square and other attractions, making it suitable for travelers who prioritize location and price over extensive services.

Club Quarters Rockefeller Center is in an excellent location for midtown Manhattan, close to many attractions and subway lines. The hotel is modern and clean, with a small lobby and rooms that are well-equipped for business travelers, with a desk and free wifi.
The Comfort Inn Chelsea is in a central location close to the subway, the Flatiron building, and Madison Square Park. Some rooms include a refrigerator, safe, and free wifi.
This hotel has a great central location with many attractions within walking distance and subway stations nearby. There is free coffee in the lobby and a free breakfast to start the day.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is in Chinatown, near subway stops and within walking distance of Little Italy and the South Seaport. The neighborhood is lively and active during the day, but quiet at night.

This hotel is located near Times Square, has friendly staff, and offers amenities like free internet and breakfast; some reviewers mention potential noise issues. Rooms are small and clean, with comfortable beds.

The Comfort Inn on 44th St. is located in the Theater District, near Times Square and many restaurants, with subway and bus stops close by. The hotel offers a basic free breakfast, free wifi, and a computer with internet access in the lobby.

The Comfort Inn offers a budget-friendly, basic accommodation with clean rooms and a complimentary continental breakfast. It is conveniently located within walking distance of major attractions and public transportation, though some found the surrounding area isolated.

The hotel is centrally located near Times Square, with easy access to transportation and attractions. It offers a continental breakfast and clean, modern rooms, although some guests have noted they can be small.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, trendy hotel with no front desk, where staff greets you with a drink upon arrival. The hotel has a library-themed lobby, a lounge, and friendly staff that can help with requests and recommendations.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is a clean and comfortable budget hotel in Tribeca, with subway access right outside and within walking distance of downtown attractions. Though rooms are small and some noise from the street, the hotel offers a good location near cafes and restaurants.

The hotel has friendly staff, is very clean, and many reviewers noted that the beds were very comfortable. It is conveniently located near major attractions and public transportation, making it easy to explore the city.
The Courtyard Upper East Side is noted for its friendly and helpful staff. It is in a quiet, residential area, a bit removed from the typical tourist attractions, but close to bus lines.

The Courtyard Marriott on Fifth Avenue is in a central location within walking distance of many attractions like Times Square and Grand Central Station. The rooms are small and clean, with comfortable beds.
The Courtyard Midtown East is in a convenient location with a subway close by, and the area is generally quiet, particularly on the upper floors. Rooms are notably spacious for New York City.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of SoHo and features individually designed rooms, a bar with a wide selection of drinks, and a restaurant. The staff is attentive and the hotel has a relaxed atmosphere, with guests feeling welcomed and at ease.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square is in a central location and puts you in the heart of the action. Due to renovations at the hotel, some amenities may be unavailable and may lead to changes in the availability of rooms.

The Da Vinci Hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to many attractions and close to subway lines. The rooms are small but clean, and the hotel offers free internet access in the lobby.

The Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square is centrally located with easy access to transportation and many attractions, making it easy to explore the city without extensive planning. Some guests liked that the discount tickets to broadway shows were right across the street from the hotel.

The Doubletree Hotel Chelsea is a modern, clean hotel with a friendly staff, and is conveniently located near Penn Station, Times Square, and other attractions. However, it's worth noting that the rooms are small, and the elevators can be slow, potentially causing delays.

The Doubletree Metropolitan is in a convenient midtown location with a subway stop at the corner, with many reviewers praising the helpful staff. The bar is lively and rooms are small to average in size.

The Dream Hotel is a trendy and modern hotel in the heart of Manhattan, near Times Square and Central Park, with a rooftop bar that provides great views. Rooms are small and stylish, suitable for younger crowds but can be noisy due to street traffic and nearby clubs.
The Duane Street Hotel is located in Tribeca, close to subway lines for easy access to the city. The hotel is small and modern, with comfortable beds, and is near many restaurants and attractions.

The Dylan Hotel is located near Grand Central Station, making it convenient for transportation and sightseeing. Some guests found the rooms to be quiet, while others experienced noise from air conditioning units or street traffic.

Eastgate Tower is a budget-friendly hotel that is not luxurious but spacious, with large rooms and suites that include kitchens. It's located in Midtown near Grand Central Terminal, close to restaurants, delis, and transportation, but in a quiet, safe neighborhood.
The Econo Lodge Times Square is known for its central location near Times Square and Broadway theaters. Rooms are small and clean, and a complimentary continental breakfast is provided.
This Embassy Suites is located in a quiet area, near the river, and the hotel is modern and clean, and has views of the Hudson. It is a bit out of the way, but it is close to lower Manhatten.

The Empire Hotel is a trendy, recently renovated hotel with a lobby bar and a rooftop bar that attracts a lively crowd, though the rooftop pool is small and may be closed for private events. Some guests experienced noise from the street or from the rooftop nightclub, and rooms may be small.

The Envoy Club offers spacious apartment-style rooms with fully equipped kitchens, providing a home-away-from-home experience, and is located within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building. Keep in mind that it is more like an apartment building with limited hotel services and front desk hours.

The hotel is located in the Financial District near Wall Street and the South Street Seaport, with subway access. Rooms are large for NYC standards and include a fridge and microwave; a breakfast buffet is included.
The Excelsior Hotel is located in a residential area near Central Park and a subway stop. The hotel generally has clean rooms, but several reviews mention that the front desk staff can be rude.

The Fairfield Inn is centrally located near Times Square, with a subway entrance close by, making it easy to access various parts of the city. The hotel offers clean and comfortable rooms, free breakfast, and complimentary internet access.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is located near Grand Central Station, providing easy access to transportation and various parts of the city, and is described as clean, quiet and comfortable. Some reviewers mention the friendly staff, outdoor patio, nearby restaurants and pubs, and that you can walk to major attractions like Times Square.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is praised for its excellent location, with easy access to shopping, Central Park, and subway lines, making it convenient for exploring the city. The friendly and helpful staff contribute to a welcoming and comfortable atmosphere.

Flatotel has a prime midtown location near Times Square and Central Park, with spacious rooms, though some are unrenovated. Some found it suitable for tourists, while others experienced issues like slow elevators and inconsistent service.

The Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea is in a central location with many subway stations nearby, making it easy to get around the city. Some reviewers mentioned a lively bar and some noise from the surrounding neighborhood.
The Four Points Soho is in a convenient location near subways and within walking distance of SoHo and Greenwich Village. It has a friendly staff, clean, modern rooms, and free Wi-Fi.

The Four Points Times Square is a new, clean hotel in a convenient Midtown location close to Times Square and the subway. Some reviews mention the surrounding area is a bit seedy with adult shops and the Port Authority bus terminal across the street.

The Four Seasons New York receives praise for its excellent staff, concierge services, and luxurious rooms; the hotel has a grand lobby, spacious rooms with comfortable beds and marble bathrooms with fast-filling tubs. Some reviewers note that the service could be inconsistent and that the hotel can be quite expensive, especially for food and beverages.

Gild Hall is located in the Financial District, which is described as quiet, especially on weekends, and close to several subway lines, making it easy to get around Manhattan. The hotel is also near attractions like the South Street Seaport and the Brooklyn Bridge.

Gramercy Park Hotel is known for its trendy, hip atmosphere, with popular bars (Rose Bar, Jade Bar, rooftop lounge) that attract a stylish crowd, though access can be difficult even for hotel guests; the hotel's decor is dark and eclectic, with artwork and unique furnishings throughout. The hotel offers a rooftop terrace open only to hotel guests.
The Grand Hyatt is a large, busy hotel with an impressive lobby. The hotel is located next to Grand Central Terminal, which provides easy access to transportation, shops, and restaurants.

The Greenwich Hotel is known for its relaxing and stylish atmosphere, featuring a gorgeous spa and a warm, European-inspired decor that feels like a home away from home. Guests appreciate the comfortable and inviting public areas like the drawing room and courtyard, as well as the complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic drinks.

The Hampton Inn Empire State Building is centrally located near the subway, Macy's, and other attractions, offering free breakfast, Wi-Fi, and a business center. Some reviews mention the staff is helpful and the hotel is clean and modern.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden offers a central location near Penn Station and various attractions, with complimentary breakfast, free internet, and helpful staff. Though the rooms are small, they are clean and well-maintained, providing a comfortable base for exploring the city.

The Hampton Inn Chelsea offers a convenient location near subway lines and various attractions, making it easy to explore different parts of Manhattan. The hotel provides clean, comfortable rooms and complimentary amenities such as breakfast, coffee, and internet access, allowing for a relaxed and flexible travel experience.

The Hampton Inn Soho is in a convenient location near subways and various downtown neighborhoods, with a 24-hour coffee service and a free, basic breakfast, allowing for flexibility in daily planning. The hotel also has helpful staff that can provide recommendations for places to eat, tourist attractions, and directions.

The Hampton Inn Times Square South is a small, narrow, high-rise hotel with only 6 rooms per floor and a basic but adequate free buffet breakfast. It is conveniently located near Times Square, Broadway, and Penn Station, but some guests have noted the surrounding area may seem seedy or in transition.

The Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District is in a good location near the South Street Seaport and subway, with clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a friendly staff. Breakfast is included, and the hotel is within walking distance of many downtown attractions.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older, centrally-located hotel with large rooms that can be a great value, though some guests report the decor is dated and in need of renovation. It offers a basic continental breakfast in the lobby and is within walking distance to many attractions, though the lobby itself is small.

The hotel is in a central Manhattan location, within walking distance of Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City Hall, Broadway shows, and Times Square. It is also close to key subway entrances and a train station, with taxis readily available.

Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is known for its friendly and helpful staff, and comfortable rooms with amenities like a microwave, fridge, and free Wi-Fi, catering to a relaxed and convenient stay. The hotel's location near subway lines and walking distance to attractions offers flexibility in exploring the city without strict itineraries.

The Hilton Garden Inn on 35th Street is in an excellent location close to the subway, Macy's, Empire State Building, Penn Station, and Times Square. Rooms include a microwave, coffee maker, and fridge; free coffee is offered in the lobby every morning.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, near Times Square and various subway lines, making it easy to explore different parts of the city. The hotel offers clean and well-equipped rooms with amenities such as free Wi-Fi, a refrigerator, and a microwave.

The hotel is located near the A, C, and E subway lines and within walking distance of SoHo, Tribeca, Chinatown, and the Brooklyn Bridge. It offers comfortable rooms with adjustable beds, a refrigerator, and a microwave, as well as free internet access and a fitness center.

The Hilton New York is a large, busy hotel in Midtown Manhattan with a bustling lobby, suitable for travelers who don't mind crowds and a less personalized experience. The hotel's central location provides easy access to major attractions and transportation, allowing for flexible sightseeing.

Located in the heart of Times Square, Hilton Times Square offers a unique experience with rooms starting on the 21st floor or higher, providing quiet and clean spaces. Some found the staff unhelpful and some services, like breakfast and internet, overpriced.

The Holiday Inn Express 5th Avenue is in a great, central location within walking distance of many attractions and subway lines. Though the rooms are small, the hotel is clean and modern, with free breakfast and internet.

The Holiday Inn Express Times Square is a new hotel located a short walk from Times Square, Penn Station, and Port Authority. It offers free breakfast and internet, but rooms are small and elevators can be slow.

The Holiday Inn Express Chelsea is known for its convenient location near Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and various subway lines, making it easy to explore the city. Some reviewers noted that the hotel can get crowded, especially during breakfast, and that rooms can be small, but the staff is generally helpful.

Holiday Inn Downtown/Soho is located on the edge of Chinatown, near Little Italy and a short walk to SoHo, with a subway station close by. Some rooms may be small and face noisy streets or subway lines.

The Holiday Inn Midtown offers a rooftop pool, a location close to many attractions, and rooms that are considered spacious for New York City. The pool hours are limited, and some past guests mention soundproofing issues and outdated decor.

This Holiday Inn is in a central location, close to many attractions and subway lines, making it easy to get around. The rooms are small but clean, with comfortable beds, though some guests have noted slow elevators and potential noise issues.
Hotel 17 is a budget hotel with small, clean rooms and shared bathrooms, located near Union Square. It is described as quiet, safe, quirky, and having a European-style charm.

Hotel 31 is a budget-friendly option in midtown Manhattan with a "retro feel," small rooms, and shared bathrooms, located near the Empire State Building and subway lines. The hotel generally receives positive reviews for cleanliness and helpful staff, but some guests report issues with noise, small rooms, and outdated decor.

Hotel 373 is a small, clean, and modern hotel in a central location on 5th Avenue, close to the Empire State Building and Times Square. Some rooms have views, and the hotel is near Starbucks and other cafes.

Hotel 41 is a small, clean, and modern hotel with friendly staff, offering free breakfast and a bar, and located steps from Times Square and many subway lines. Some reviewers noted smaller rooms and potential noise, while others appreciated the quietness and described it as a cozy boutique hotel.
Hotel 99 is a new hotel located on the Upper West Side, with ongoing construction in some areas. The hotel offers promotional rates and features modern rooms with LCD TVs.

Hotel Beacon is located in a neighborhood setting on the Upper West Side, close to a subway stop, restaurants, and markets, with spacious rooms that include kitchenettes; some reviewers noted a slower pace than in midtown. Some rooms have traffic noise, but higher floors offer views and relative quiet.

Hotel Chandler is a small, quiet, clean boutique hotel near the Empire State Building, offering tea and coffee in the lobby, and a gym. Some reviewers mention friendly staff and a convenient location for exploring Manhattan.

Hotel Deauville is a budget-friendly hotel in Midtown Manhattan with small, basic, but clean rooms, and is conveniently located near subway lines and within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building and Times Square. The hotel has an old-fashioned, manually operated elevator, and some rooms have shared bathrooms.

The hotel is located in a vibrant and trendy part of town, close to subway stations, Soho, Little Italy, and the East and West Village, making it easy to walk and explore the city. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the hotel offers a rooftop terrace with city views.

Hotel Elysee is a small boutique hotel with a cozy, European ambiance, offering a relaxing stay with a club room for complimentary breakfast, snacks, and evening wine. The hotel's location in midtown Manhattan provides convenient access to attractions while remaining a quiet retreat.

The Gansevoort is located in the Meatpacking District, known for nightlife, and has a rooftop bar; noise from the street and club-goers can be an issue. Some guests found the hotel trendy and fun, while others found the staff rude and the hotel overpriced.
Hotel Giraffe has a relaxing atmosphere, complimentary breakfast, evening wine and cheese, and coffee available all day. The staff is accommodating and the location is convenient.

Hotel Grand Union is a budget-friendly hotel in Midtown Manhattan, near the Empire State Building and subway lines, with clean, basic rooms that may be small and lack a view. Some rooms can be noisy, and amenities like tea/coffee makers, irons, and hairdryers may be absent, though a fridge is usually included.

The Hotel Indigo has a modern, minimalist design, with spacious rooms for NYC, comfortable beds, and Aveda toiletries. The hotel is close to the Javits Center, Times Square, Herald Square, the Meatpacking District, and subway lines.

Hotel Mela is a small, modern boutique hotel located right off Times Square, making it convenient to many attractions and transportation options, but also potentially noisy. Many reviewers found the staff friendly and helpful.
The Hotel Metro is a centrally located hotel with free continental breakfast, 24/7 coffee and tea, and a rooftop bar. The staff is helpful and can offer suggestions on where to go.

Hotel Newton is a budget-friendly option near the 96th Street subway station, providing easy access to the city, although some rooms can be small and noisy. Reviews mention friendly staff, clean rooms, and proximity to the subway and Central Park, but also note the slow elevator and potential for street noise.

The Hotel on Rivington is located in the Lower East Side, a lively and arty neighborhood with many bars and restaurants. Some reviewers noted the area can be noisy at night, while others enjoyed the views and vibe from the upper floors.
Hotel Reserve is located in a quiet area of the Financial District, near multiple subway stations, making it easy to travel anywhere in the city. The hotel is modern and clean, with friendly staff.

The St. James Hotel is a budget-friendly option with a superb location near Times Square, but it is also described as basic, old, and noisy. The reviews mention friendly staff, clean rooms, and proximity to delis and transportation, but also note small rooms and thin walls.

The Stanford Hotel is in Korea Town near the subway and Penn Station, with a continental breakfast; some rooms are renovated, spacious, and quiet, while others are small with views of brick walls. The hotel has a small, slow elevator, and some rooms lack temperature control.

Hotel Wales is described as quaint and charming with a European style, offering a rooftop terrace and a lounge on the 2nd floor with complimentary coffee and breakfast. The hotel is located in a quiet, upscale area close to Central Park and museums, but some rooms are small and can be noisy due to old AC units.

The Hudson Hotel is a trendy spot with a very young, hip vibe and a lively bar scene with music. The location is superb, close to Central Park and the subway, and the hotel staff is friendly and helpful.

Ink48 is a new hotel located on 11th Ave between 48th and 49th St, a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square, with rooms that have iPod docking stations. They offered a complimentary breakfast, as well as a wine reception each evening.

The Inn New York City is located on a quiet street on the Upper West Side, near the subway, Central Park, and various shops and restaurants. Guests have noted the staff is available but not intrusive, and the inn feels like a private home.
The hotel is centrally located, has bell service, and a comfortable lobby with seating areas. Some found the staff friendly and helpful, while others found the service to be pretentious.
The hotel has a free car service for trips within a 10-block radius, as well as free bicycles to use in Central Park. Guests can relax in the lounge or the well-regarded spa.

The Kitano is a quiet and clean hotel, with spacious rooms for NYC standards, and soundproof windows; some rooms have views of the Empire State Building or Chrysler Building. It is located near Grand Central Station in the Murray Hill neighborhood.

This hotel is in a central location, close to Penn Station, Times Square, and the Empire State Building, and is located in Korea Town, with many nearby Korean restaurants. The hotel offers a free breakfast, free internet, and a rooftop bar, but some past guests have noted slow elevators.

Lafayette House is a boutique hotel in a historic 1848 building with uniquely decorated rooms featuring antique furniture. It offers a more independent, private experience without a 24/7 concierge, and is located in a vibrant neighborhood close to various restaurants and attractions.
Le Parker Meridien is a good location for business and leisure travelers, with friendly staff, a cozy bar, and a popular burger joint. Some reviewers mention enjoying the gym and the rooftop pool.

The Library Hotel is known for being a tranquil retreat with a library theme, a small roof top bar, and a 24/7 lounge with free snacks and drinks. Many reviewers enjoyed a homelike feeling with relaxing opportunities, and noted its good location relative to transportation.

The Loews Regency is located on the Upper East Side, near Central Park and upscale shopping on Madison and 5th Avenues. It is described as pet-friendly, with amenities for pets, and some reviewers note the staff is friendly and helpful.
The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side with a location that is slightly out of the midtown hustle. It has a quiet, peaceful atmosphere, and many rooms have kitchenettes.

The Mandarin Oriental NYC is located in the Time Warner building, offering easy access to shops, restaurants, and a Whole Foods market. The hotel features a spa, pool, and lobby lounge with views of Central Park.

The Milford Plaza is a conveniently located, albeit older and smaller-sized hotel, situated right off Times Square and close to many attractions. It may not be luxurious, but it is safe and has a helpful staff, a well-equipped gym, and quick elevators.
The Millenium Hilton is located in downtown Manhattan, next to a subway station, but away from the hustle of midtown. Rooms are clean and spacious, with comfortable beds.

The Millennium Broadway is a conveniently located hotel near Times Square and Broadway with an art deco style lobby and clean rooms. Some reviewers noted slow check-in times, and a lack of available information from staff on nearby attractions.

The hotel has a gym, pool, and comfortable beds, and is located in a quiet area that is still within walking distance of many attractions including Grand Central station and multiple subway lines. Due to its location right off the highway to airports and opposite the UN it has less traffic and nice views.

The Moderne Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Central Park and offers a library with free coffee and tea. Rooms are small and may have limited natural light or views, but the hotel is near many restaurants and attractions.

Morgans Hotel has a convenient location near attractions and subway, with modern decor and a friendly staff, as well as a 4th-floor "Living Room" with complimentary tea and coffee. The complimentary continental breakfast, served until 10 or 11 am, offers a good start to the day.

Murray Hill East Suites is a budget-friendly hotel located in a convenient and quiet area of midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station. The hotel offers spacious, apartment-style rooms with kitchenettes and friendly staff.

Murray Hill Inn is a budget-friendly, no-frills hotel in Midtown Manhattan, offering clean but small rooms with a convenient location near major attractions and subway lines; note that there is no elevator, and some rooms may be noisy or have limited views. Some guests have noted the friendly and helpful staff, while others have had issues with security, noise, and room size.

The hotel is located in a quiet area in lower Manhattan, near the Hudson River and close to several subway lines, offering an escape from the hustle and bustle of midtown. Some reviewers noted that the hotel is away from the main tourist areas, but easily accessible via subway.

The Marriott East Side is noted as being centrally located, allowing easy access to many attractions and transportation options, and is also described as being in a safe neighborhood. Some guests found the hotel charming, while others noted that the rooms were small.

The Marriott Marquis is centrally located in Times Square, making it easy to walk to many attractions and subway lines. The hotel is large with many amenities including restaurants, bars, a gym and concierge services, which might appeal to travelers who want to stay on-site.

The New York Palace is known for its excellent and friendly service, with staff anticipating needs and offering assistance without being asked. Guests describe a relaxed and unpretentious atmosphere where they felt welcomed and pampered, with luxurious rooms and amenities contributing to a seamless and enjoyable stay.

The Night Hotel is a trendy, centrally located boutique hotel with a black and white theme and a small bar; it is close to Times Square and subways. Some guests found it stylish and comfortable, though rooms are small, and noise from the bar or street may be a concern.

The Novotel Times Square is in a great location for walking around Manhattan, with easy access to Times Square, Central Park, and the theater district. It is clean and well-maintained, with a friendly staff.

Off Soho Suites offers apartment-style suites with kitchens, catering to budget-conscious travelers who prioritize location and space over luxury amenities. The hotel is situated near multiple subway lines and within walking distance of several neighborhoods.
The Omni Berkshire Place is centrally located, clean, and quiet, with generally friendly and helpful staff. Select Guest members receive complimentary morning beverages, newspapers, and free wifi.

On the Ave is located in the Upper West Side, close to subway stations and Central Park, offering a less touristy environment with a neighborhood feel. The surrounding area is considered safe and has restaurants, diners, and markets.

The Park 79 is a budget-friendly hotel located in the Upper West Side, near Central Park and subway stations. Reviews mention small rooms, thin walls, and shared bathrooms, but also friendly staff and cleanliness.

Park Central Hotel is conveniently located near many attractions and subway lines, making it easy to explore the city. Some found the staff helpful and the rooms clean, while others experienced slow elevators and noise.

The Park South Hotel is described as a clean, quiet, and comfortable hotel with a subway stop conveniently located nearby. Reviewers note the hotel is located in a safe neighborhood with an ample continental breakfast and a friendly staff.
The Peninsula New York is known for its attentive and friendly staff, luxurious rooms, and a rooftop bar with city views. The hotel also offers a pool, spa, and gym facilities for relaxation.

The Phillips Club offers studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments with kitchens for daily, weekly, or monthly rentals, and is located near Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, and a subway station. While not a full-service hotel, it provides a comfortable, apartment-style experience with nearby conveniences like Balducci's gourmet market.

The Plaza Athenee is a quiet, intimate European-style hotel located on the Upper East Side, near Central Park and Madison Avenue. The staff is attentive and the hotel has a residential feel, with a cozy bar and restaurant.

The Radisson Martinique is in a fantastic location close to shopping, Times Square, and Penn Station, with a subway stop right outside. Some guests experienced slow check-in, small rooms, and noise issues, but most found the staff helpful.
The Ramada Eastside is centrally located in Manhattan near the subway, Empire State Building, and various restaurants. It offers free breakfast and internet, with clean, small rooms.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is a conveniently located, clean, and comfortable hotel, with many reviewers mentioning the close proximity to major attractions like the Empire State Building and Times Square. Some reviewers noted that the elevators can be slow and that the breakfast room is small, but overall the hotel offers good value and a pleasant stay.

Hotel 57 is located in midtown Manhattan, close to subway stations, shopping, and Central Park, allowing for easy exploration of the city. The hotel has a bar and lounge, and is near a Starbucks and other dining options.

The Renaissance New York Times Square is located in the heart of Times Square, offering a central location near theaters and subway lines. Some reviewers note the hotel is clean, quiet, and has comfortable beds, but recent renovations may cause inconveniences.

The Residence Inn Times Square is centrally located, close to public transportation, and offers amenities such as free breakfast, a lounge, and kitchen facilities, making it easy to relax and be spontaneous. Rooms are spacious and clean, with comfortable beds, and the hotel is known for its friendly and helpful staff.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park is known for being quiet, providing a relaxing environment away from the touristy atmosphere of Midtown, and excellent service. The hotel's location in Battery Park offers beautiful views of the harbor and Statue of Liberty, with generally spacious, clean rooms.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel is centrally located near many attractions and subway lines, making it easy to explore the city, with self-service check-in kiosks for efficient arrivals and departures. Some rooms include amenities like coffee makers and mini-fridges.

The Roger Smith Hotel is a boutique hotel with unique, uniquely decorated rooms, a friendly staff, and a location near Grand Central Terminal. Many reviewers mention a homey, comfortable, and cozy atmosphere.

The Roger Williams Hotel in Murray Hill is near subway, shopping, dining and tourist spots, yet the neighborhood is quiet, and the rooms are spotless, comfortable and decorated with trendy elegant designs. The staff are friendly, helpful, and knowledgable with guests often greeted by name.

Room Mate Grace is a trendy, modern, and clean hotel that offers a hip, European-style atmosphere, a pool with a swim-up bar, a bar, and a lively scene with DJs and parties, particularly on weekends. The hotel has a location near Times Square, a 24-hour store with beverages, free breakfast, and amenities like a pool, sauna, and steam room.
The Royalton Hotel has a dark, trendy lobby with fireplaces and a popular bar area. It is centrally located near Times Square and Fifth Avenue.

The Salisbury Hotel is in a great central location, offering a reasonable price and clean, spacious rooms for you to enjoy New York without thinking too hard about it. Keep in mind the decor is outdated, so it's not necessarily modern and luxurious.

The San Carlos Hotel is a clean and comfortable hotel in a great midtown location, with a friendly and helpful staff. Rooms include amenities like a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker, and guests can enjoy a free continental breakfast.

Seafarers International House is a budget-friendly accommodation located near Union Square, a central subway hub, making it easy to get around Manhattan. The rooms are basic but clean, and the hotel offers amenities such as free internet access and luggage storage.
Many reviewers mention that the hotel is busy and crowded, especially the lobby. The concierges provide good dining and activity recommendations.

The Skyline Hotel is known for its spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and a convenient location within walking distance of Times Square and other attractions. It also offers amenities like an indoor pool and cheap parking.
The Smyth Tribeca is located in a vibrant downtown neighborhood and has a subway station right outside. Many reviewers describe the hotel as clean, comfortable, and modern, with a friendly staff.

The Sofitel New York has a convenient central location and is within walking distance of many attractions. The hotel has efficient service, and offers complimentary chocolates, water, and classical music to create a relaxing experience.

The Soho Grand is known for its casual vibe, cool atmosphere, and lobby bar where guests can chill, with some reviewers highlighting the helpful and friendly staff. Though some found the rooms small and noted that the hotel was showing its age, many enjoyed the location near Soho shops and subway lines.

Soho House New York is a trendy hotel with a rooftop pool and bar, and a location in the Meatpacking District surrounded by bars, restaurants, and clubs. The hotel has a party atmosphere and offers free access to Soho House events, a pool table, board games, and free wi-fi.

The Stay Hotel is located close to Times Square with a trendy lobby and bar that turns into a lively nightclub on weekends until 4 AM. Keep in mind that rooms are small, elevators are slow, and noise may be an issue on lower floors.

The Alex Hotel generally receives positive reviews for its helpful staff, amenities, and location near Grand Central Station, but negative reviews mention potential issues like small rooms, thin walls, and elevators being tied up by staff. Many guests were upgraded to suites upon arrival and found comfortable rooms, with some rooms having kitchenettes.

The Belvedere Hotel is in a convenient midtown location with many attractions within walking distance, a helpful staff, and storage available; some guests found the hotel warm and comfortable, with refrigerators in every room. While some found the hotel quiet and relaxing, other guests reported elevators that were slow and small, and noisy rooms due to street traffic or thin walls.

The Benjamin is known for its friendly and helpful staff, with some reviewers highlighting that needs were met immediately and the staff was eager to please. Some reviewers mention the availability of hot cider in the lobby.

The Blakely Hotel is centrally located, near many attractions like Central Park and Times Square, and subway stations. Select reviews mention friendly and accommodating staff, as well as clean and comfortable rooms.

The Bowery Hotel has a relaxed atmosphere, friendly staff, and a comfortable lobby and bar area that are popular with locals. It is located in a vibrant, walkable neighborhood close to many restaurants and shops.

The Bryant Park Hotel is centrally located and has a trendy bar/club, though some found the front desk staff to be unhelpful. Some guests found the music in the lobby/elevators, the active bar scene, and the potential for noise from Bryant Park to be energetic and exciting.

Carlton Hotel is in a good location with easy access to subway lines and many sights, and the surrounding area is generally quiet. Though some found the rooms small, others found them spacious and well-equipped.

The Carlyle is a traditional hotel with old-school New York charm, offering personalized service, a classy atmosphere, and a quiet location near Central Park and Madison Avenue boutiques. It features a lobby with black marble floors, a formal restaurant, a hotel bar, and the supper club Cafe Carlyle.
The Franklin Hotel has a friendly staff, offers complimentary breakfast and evening wine and cheese, and is located near the subway. It is in a quiet, safe neighborhood on the Upper East Side.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is located in the Theater District on Restaurant Row, close to Times Square and subway lines, with many restaurants and bars nearby. The hotel offers a continental breakfast, and rooms include kitchenettes.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea is noted for its friendly and helpful staff, with mentions of specific staff members like Cesar and Keith. The hotel provides amenities such as free Wi-Fi and bottled water, and is located near a subway stop and various restaurants in the Chelsea area.
The Gem Hotel is a smaller, modern hotel with clean, compact rooms. It is located within walking distance of Times Square, Penn Station, and Madison Square Garden.

The Gem Hotel Soho is located near the subway, Whole Foods, Katz's Deli, Little Italy, Chinatown, and the Lower East Side. Rooms include a mini fridge, microwave, and free wireless internet, and staff are helpful with directions and recommendations.

The Grant Hotel is a budget-friendly option with small, basic rooms and shared bathrooms, located on the Upper West Side near the subway. Some guests reported clean rooms and friendly staff, while others mentioned issues with bugs, noise, and inconsistent cleanliness.

The Hampton Inn Times Square North is centrally located with great access to the subway, and multiple reviewers found it easy to come and go. Some reviewers mention 24/7 availability of free coffee, tea, and hot chocolate in the lobby, as well as luggage storage.

The hotel offers spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes, and is located one block from Central Park, close to shopping and restaurants. Some rooms have balconies, and the hotel provides services such as elevator operators.
This hotel is in a great location near Central Park and 5th avenue, allowing for easy access to major sites. Some found the hotel decor dated and worn, while others found it elegant.
Herald Square Hotel is a budget-friendly option in Midtown Manhattan, with clean but small rooms. It has comfortable beds, friendly staff, and is undergoing renovations.
Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Chinatown, with easy access to the subway, Little Italy, and the Lower East Side. The hotel is clean, with comfortable beds, and offers free coffee and tea.

The Hotel at Times Square is in a great location, near Times Square and many attractions, but not directly in the busiest area and has quiet rooms. Some guests have noted a helpful staff, a nice lobby, and comfortable beds and free WIFI.

The Inn at Irving Place is a 19th-century-style inn with a tea salon and bar, offering a unique escape within the city. Some guests have noted noise from the bar and street, while others have found the hotel to be a quiet oasis.

The Iroquois is centrally located in midtown Manhattan near many attractions, with guests noting the friendly, helpful staff and a cozy, intimate atmosphere. Some reviews mention the hotel's quietness, comfortable beds, and lack of street noise in some rooms.

The Jane is a micro-hotel with small, cabin-like rooms, shared bathrooms that are generally clean, and friendly staff. It's located in the West Village, close to the Meatpacking District, with subway access a few blocks away.

The Kimberly Hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan, close to the subway and within walking distance of many attractions. The hotel offers suites with kitchens and comfortable beds, and some rooms have balconies.

The Lombardy is a boutique hotel with individually owned studio or one-bedroom apartments, each decorated differently under central management control. It is centrally located near restaurants, shops, and the subway, with spacious rooms and a reputation for being quiet.

The London NYC is in an ideal location, within walking distance of many attractions; many reviewers praised the helpful staff and spacious rooms. Some reviewers mention easy access to cabs, while others report issues such as noise and slow service.

The Lucerne is in a convenient Upper West Side location near Central Park and many restaurants, with a subway stop nearby for easy access to other parts of Manhattan. Guests describe it as clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, with attentive staff.

The Manhattan Club is centrally located, close to many attractions including Central Park and Times Square; note that there is no room service. Reviewers mention clean rooms and spacious suites, but some report slow elevators.

The Mansfield Hotel is a small, older hotel in a prime midtown location, with many rooms recently updated and a cozy library and bar, but some rooms can be noisy due to street traffic or air conditioning units. Guests may be able to relax at the complimentary coffee bar or enjoy a drink at the M Bar.
The Marcel at Gramercy is a modern, clean, and trendy hotel in a great location with a friendly staff. The hotel offers small but comfortable rooms and a rooftop terrace.

The Maritime Hotel has a nautical theme, small rooms, and a lively atmosphere with bars and restaurants. Some guests have noted noise from the downstairs club and outdoor spaces, but the hotel provides window plugs to help block out the sound.
The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. Some reviewers mention that the hotel has a helpful and courteous staff.

The Marmara Manhattan offers spacious apartment-style rooms with full kitchens, catering to both short and extended stays in a residential Upper East Side location. It's near subway stations for easy access to the city, but away from the bustle of midtown.
The Mave Hotel is centrally located near subway stations and attractions like Madison Square Park, offering easy access to midtown Manhattan. The hotel has a friendly, helpful staff.

The Mercer has a relaxed vibe in the lobby, which is exclusively for hotel guests, where you can sit, lounge around, and have a drink. The staff are helpful and can assist with suggestions for restaurants and finding city treasures.

The Michelangelo Hotel is centrally located near Times Square and Broadway, offering a quiet and calm atmosphere with comfortable, spacious, and clean rooms, though some rooms have limited views and noisy air conditioning. The hotel provides complimentary coffee and pastries in the morning.

The Milburn Hotel is located on the Upper West Side, near Central Park, with subway access for exploring the city, and the surrounding area is considered safe and quiet. Rooms include kitchenettes, and grocery stores are nearby for affordable meal options.

The Muse Hotel is described as a trendy, modern, and creative boutique hotel with a relaxing wineglass invitation every afternoon and a glamourous bar, located a minute away from Times Square on a quiet small street. Some reviewers describe it as quiet and peaceful, while others mention street noise, nearby construction, and thin windows.

The New York Helmsley is located near Grand Central Station, Times Square, and other attractions, making it easy to get around. Some guests noted that it is possible to just turn up and see where the mood takes them.

The New Yorker Hotel is conveniently located near Penn Station, major subway lines, and attractions like Times Square and Macy's, and many reviewers mention that it is easy to walk anywhere from the hotel. The hotel houses a 24-hour diner (Tick Tock Diner) and is known for its Art Deco style.

The Pierre is a traditionally decorated hotel with friendly staff, elevator operators, and a location across from Central Park. Some rooms have loud AC units that cannot be adjusted, and construction may be ongoing.

The Plaza is in a central location near Central Park and 5th Avenue, with spacious rooms and luxurious bedding. The hotel offers attentive service and amenities such as a butler, though some public rooms may still be under renovation.

The Pod Hotel is praised for its great location, cleanliness, funky and hip atmosphere, and nearby subway access, making it a convenient and welcoming base for exploring NYC. Many reviewers note the small but well-designed rooms, with shared bathrooms that are consistently clean and readily available.

The Premier is described as a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, offering complimentary breakfast, evening drinks, and concierge service. Rooms feature amenities like flat-screen TVs and comfortable lounging areas, with some offering views of the Chrysler Building and Times Square.

The Ritz Carlton Central Park is known for its impeccable service, attentive staff, and a location across the street from Central Park. Many reviewers mention the availability of a house car, sometimes a Bentley or Maybach, for complimentary transportation within midtown.
The Roosevelt Hotel has a very convenient location near Grand Central Station and many attractions. The service can be inconsistent and the hotel can be very busy.

The Sherry-Netherland is a smaller, intimate hotel comprised of individually owned and decorated rooms/suites, offering a unique experience with each stay. Staff aim to provide personalized service and will try to accommodate requests for different rooms if available.

The Shoreham is a trendy, modern boutique hotel with a good location, a small bar, and a 24/7 coffee machine. Some guests had issues with check-in, small rooms, and noise, while others found the staff helpful and the location convenient for shopping and attractions.
The St. Regis is known for its butler service, where staff anticipates guest needs, and luxurious rooms. It offers a relaxing, quiet environment with high-end amenities and a convenient location.

The hotel has a "go with the flow" attitude, offering a trendy and unique atmosphere, a lively bar scene, and a central location in the Meatpacking District. There are multiple lounge spaces on the ground floor, both indoors and out, with the largest being outdoors under (and protected by) the High Line.

The Surrey is located on the Upper East Side, a few minutes walk to Central Park, with large rooms and kitchenettes in some suites. The hotel provides a quiet, unpretentious atmosphere with friendly and helpful staff.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in Harlem, near a grocery store and multiple subway lines, including an express line. It features apartments with well-equipped kitchens, terraces, luxury bathrooms, and African art decorations.

The Time Hotel is in a prime location close to Times Square and Broadway, but some guests found the front desk unhelpful, staff to be "lacking," and the rooms small and noisy, especially those on the lower floors.
The hotel's bar is trendy but can be loud on weekends and may be closed for private events.

The Waldorf Astoria is an older, historic hotel with traditional decor and a large, busy lobby, and the central location allows easy access to midtown attractions. Keep in mind rooms are known to vary, some being dated with small bathrooms, and some guests report service inconsistencies.

The Westin New York at Times Square is centrally located near the Port Authority bus terminal, subway, restaurants, attractions, and theaters, making it easy to walk or take transportation anywhere. The hotel offers upscale amenities and a comfortable, clean room, but some services have been noted as slow and the hotel can be crowded.

Hotel Thirty Thirty is in midtown Manhattan, within walking distance of attractions and close to subway lines. Reviews mention it is clean, comfortable and a good base for exploring the city with easy access to restaurants and bars.

The Thompson LES is a modern, trendy hotel in the Lower East Side, known for its proximity to various restaurants, bars, and shops. Some guests noted that the hotel was still under construction during their stays, with amenities like the pool, gym, and restaurant not yet open.

The Travel Inn is a budget-friendly hotel centrally located near Times Square and various transportation options, including free parking. Some rooms have views of the pool or Empire State Building, but noise can be an issue in street-facing rooms.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy hotel with a popular bar/lounge that is open late, sometimes with a DJ, and live music, that can be noisy in the rooms, although some rooms have white noise machines to help with this. The hotel is located in a convenient area in walking distance to Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy, with subway stops just a block away.

The Trump International Hotel offers excellent service, luxurious rooms, and a central location next to Central Park and Columbus Circle. Guests have access to a well-equipped gym, spa, and a variety of dining options.

The Tudor Hotel is located in a quiet area, a few blocks from Grand Central station, making it a convenient spot for exploring the city. Some reviewers found the rooms to be small and basic, but clean.

The Avalon, now Vincci Avalon, is a centrally located hotel with clean, spacious rooms, but some guests have noted issues with the finicky air conditioning and some noise. The staff has generally been described as friendly and helpful, but some guests have mentioned the service can be inconsistent.

W The Court is in a convenient midtown location with a hip atmosphere, though some find it noisy due to thin walls and street traffic. The hotel has a lobby bar, and some rooms have views of the Chrysler Building.

The W Tuscany is in a convenient Midtown location, close to Grand Central Station, with generally spacious rooms for NYC and a friendly staff. It is next to another W Hotel, the Court, and some amenities are shared between the two.

The W Times Square is a trendy, modern hotel with a hip atmosphere, a bustling lobby bar, and rooms featuring comfortable beds. While some find it energetic and lively, others note the noise, crowds, and smaller rooms.
The W Union Square has a stylish and hip atmosphere, with a popular lobby bar that attracts a trendy crowd. However, some reviewers found the hotel to be noisy, crowded, and the service inconsistent.

The Waldorf Towers is located in Midtown Manhattan with spacious rooms and suites, and offers a private entrance separate from the Waldorf Astoria. Some reviewers mention impeccable service, while others describe a lack of care from staff and long waits for service requests.

The Wall Street Inn is a smaller, quiet hotel located in the Financial District, close to subway stations and some attractions like the Staten Island Ferry and Battery Park. It offers a continental breakfast and rooms with amenities like free Wi-Fi and comfortable beds.

The Warwick is centrally located near Times Square and Central Park and offers large rooms. Some rooms have nice views, but others face brick walls and can be dark and some guests have noted issues with noise.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel is in a great location, close to Times Square, theaters, and Central Park, but rooms are small, and some rooms may be noisy. Some guests recommend requesting a room on a higher floor or away from the street to avoid noise.

Washington Square Hotel is in Greenwich Village near shops, restaurants, bars, and a subway station; rooms tend to be small, but are clean and recently renovated, and the hotel has a restaurant and includes complimentary breakfast. The area is vibrant, with a mix of student and upper-class vibes, and offers a quieter alternative to the bustle of Times Square.

The Wellington Hotel has a perfect central location with a subway stop on the doorstep and easy access to the subway. The staff is friendly and can provide helpful information to allow guests to "go with the flow."

The hotel has a great location near Central Park and the Theater District, with subway access. It features modern decor, comfortable rooms, and an owners lounge with complimentary breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres.

The Wingate provides earplugs and white noise machines due to street noise, and some guests found the hotel quiet, particularly on higher floors or in the back. It offers a free breakfast, free internet, and is centrally located near Penn Station, Times Square, and Macy's.

The Wolcott Hotel is centrally located near attractions like the Empire State Building and Times Square, offering clean but basic rooms. It provides complimentary coffee and muffins, and while some past guests have mentioned small bathrooms and slow elevators, the location and price are generally viewed as a good value.

Woogo Central Park Apartments offers a no-frills, apartment-style stay with kitchenettes, near the subway and Central Park; some reviews mention a lack of daily cleaning services and basic amenities. Some reviews mention the hotel is not very luxurious, but still a great value for the price.
This hotel has a friendly staff and is in a good location close to transportation hubs, which helps in just going with the flow. Keep in mind that this is a smaller hotel and the rooms may be small.
